columns.department: VARCHAR(100) - Department name (IT, Sales, HR, Finance, Operations)
columns.hire_date: DATE - Date when employee was hired
columns.manager_id: INTEGER - ID of direct manager (foreign key to employee_id)

notes: Use date() function for date comparisons
Always include LIMIT clause for large results
Departments: IT, Sales, HR, Finance, Operations
Manager_id can be NULL for top-level executives
For tenure calculations: use julianday('now') - julianday(hire_date)
